instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power.
With one side of the charger conected, the ampmeter stays full black. If I switch the side of the power cable, the ampmeter just blinks.

On F4700, when the ampmeter blinks, I only get 2.5-7 V
F4700 diode value is ok (0.554)

<SIGNAL>E85_CC1</SIGNAL>/2 diode values seams to be ok (0.547).

<SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_VDDA</SIGNAL>/P diode values also seams ok (0.445)

Should I replace <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Start with <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> and continue with <CHIP>U4780</CHIP>, if needed.
<SIGNAL>3V0_AON</SIGNAL> diode mode to ground?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
You're right.

 <SIGNAL>3V0_AON</SIGNAL>  was shorted and after replacing <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> it powered on gain. 

TKS!
